Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential impact of the asteroid by stating that it is expected to hit Earth, when in fact it will pass by at a safe distance.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim does not falter at any point.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that an asteroid will hit Earth.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that an asteroid will hit Earth without providing any evidence or reasoning.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
